perturbation.original_text: D. Payment. Both Parties agree that once the Parties have agreed to transaction which includes the purchase and sale of the Product that the Buyer will remit payment upon execution of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: D. Payment. Both Parties agree that once the Parties have agreed to transaction which includes the purchase and sale of the Product that the Buyer will remit payment within 30 days of execution of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that payment will be remitted 'upon execution of this agreement,' meaning immediately. The modified text provides for payment within 30 days of execution of the agreement. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the payment deadline, introducing uncertainty about when payment is actually due.

perturbation.original_text: A. Termination. Either Party may terminate this Agreement at any time prior to delivery of the Product.
perturbation.changed_text: A. Termination. Either Party may terminate this Agreement at any time prior to delivery of the Product, provided that a termination fee of $10,000 is paid to the other party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows termination at any time before delivery. The modified text adds a termination fee, creating a contradiction. It's now unclear whether termination is truly 'at any time' or subject to a financial penalty, leading to uncertainty and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: C. Confidential Information. In the course of performing their respective obligations, each party will enter into possession of information of the other party which the Parties wish to protect and deem "Confidential Information." This will include all Intellectual Property, processes, pricing, and any information that is marked confidential. When the Agreement ends, each party shall return all copies of any such information to the other and take every reasonable measure to preclude its representatives from sharing or keeping such information. Failure to do so shall constitute a material breach of this Agreement with all rights and remedies available to the party whose material has been Disclosed.
perturbation.changed_text: C. Confidential Information. In the course of performing their respective obligations, each party will enter into possession of information of the other party which the Parties wish to protect and deem "Confidential Information." This will include all Intellectual Property, processes, pricing, and any information that is marked confidential. When the Agreement ends, each party shall return all copies of any such information to the other. Failure to do so may constitute a breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that failure to return confidential information constitutes a 'material breach' of the agreement, which provides specific legal ramifications. The modified text states that the same failure 'may' constitute a breach, removing the mandatory nature of the 'material breach' clause and diminishing the ramifications and certainty of enforcement. This creates a contradiction as the severity of not returning confidential information is in conflict.
